title: How to Make Double Layer Mint Fudge

steps.headline: Cover a 13 x 9" pan with foil.
steps.description: Make sure that the foil goes over the pan sides. Lightly butter the foil to avoid stickiness.

steps.headline: Melt the chocolate chips over low heat.
steps.description: Stir the chocolate until it's a smooth texture.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat and add the chocolate frosting.
Stir ingredients together and spread on foil.
steps.description: Place pan in the refrigerator for 20 minutes.

steps.headline: Melt the vanilla chips over low heat.
steps.description: Stir the chips until it's a smooth texture.

steps.headline: Remove it from the heat and add the vanilla frosting and food drops.
Stir the ingredients together and fold & stir in the crushed peppermint candy.
Use a plastic spatula to spread the vanilla peppermint mix over the chilled chocolate layer.
Use the chopped chocolate bars as a garnish by sprinkling on top.
Lift the foil carefully, so you can lift the fudge from the pan.

text: Cover a 13 x 9" pan with foil. Make sure that the foil goes over the pan sides. Lightly butter the foil to avoid stickiness. Melt the chocolate chips over low heat. Stir the chocolate until it's a smooth texture. Remove from the heat and add the chocolate frosting.  Stir ingredients together and spread on foil. Place pan in the refrigerator for 20 minutes. Melt the vanilla chips over low heat. Stir the chips until it's a smooth texture. Remove it from the heat and add the vanilla frosting and food drops.  Stir the ingredients together and fold & stir in the crushed peppermint candy.  Use a plastic spatula to spread the vanilla peppermint mix over the chilled chocolate layer.  Use the chopped chocolate bars as a garnish by sprinkling on top.  Refrigerate for about an hour.  Lift the foil carefully, so you can lift the fudge from the pan. Cut the fudge in 13 x 9 rows. Store at room temperature.
